definition: to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to put on airs/to assume great airs
to put up scaffolding/to build a framework/to launch an enterprise
to throw one's weight around/to put on airs
stinking pretension/to give oneself airs and offend others/hateful arrogance
lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)

sentences.english: She put the medicine on the top shelf beyond the reach of her son .
sentences.chinese: 她把藥放在了兒子夠不着的最上面的架子上。

sentences.english: My elder brother and I loaded the handcart with wheat and pulled it home.
sentences.chinese: 我和哥哥用架子車裝了一車麥子拉回家。

sentences.english: Number the books on the shelf please.
sentences.chinese: 請把架子上的書編上號。

sentences.english: Then old Peter took his big coat off and lifted down the samovar from the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 老彼得脫下大衣，從架子上拿起茶炊。

sentences.english: Books hang on metal strips, creating the levitation effect. [link]
sentences.chinese: 書本都懸掛在金屬架子上，創造出一種懸浮的效果。

sentences.english: Here we get to eat as much as we want, and the men don't bother us!
sentences.chinese: 我們不愁喫不愁穿，又沒有臭男人擺架子。

sentences.english: The spy is shy of tsimilarg shelter on the shelf of the shell-like shed.
sentences.chinese: 特工怕在殼子一樣的棚裏的架子上居住。

sentences.english: You can even slip them into the wall to build a step shelf-like design.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以把它們插到牆壁裏變成一個階梯式的架子。

sentences.english: The metal stand next to the desk is a local flea market find.
sentences.chinese: 桌子旁邊的金屬架子是在本地的跳蚤市場買的。
我們會花很多時間玩一種叫做“架子球”的遊戲。

sentences.english: The successful physicist never puts on airs.
sentences.chinese: 這位卓有成就的物理學家從不搭架子。

sentences.english: That shelf was too low so we raised it a few inches.
sentences.chinese: 那個架子太低了，因此我們把它架高了幾英寸。

sentences.english: He made room on his shelf for me to put some books.
sentences.chinese: 他在書架子上騰了些地方，讓我放幾本書。

sentences.english: The weight of the books bears on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 書籍的重量都壓在架子上。

sentences.english: SCULLY is looking on the shelves for the fish food.
sentences.chinese: 史高麗在架子上找魚食。

sentences.english: Nowadays, many cadres tend to put on a hollow display in their work.
sentences.chinese: 現在的許多幹部在工作中爲了表現自己往往擺花架子。

definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
small side table/coffee table/teapoy (ornamental tripod with caddies for tea)
junk/items of no value/various bits and bobs
